questions.question: A rod of 3.22 cm<sup>2</sup> is subjected to static mean tensile load of 44.5kN. What fatigue stress amplitude σ<sub>a</sub> will produce failure after 106 cycles? Assume σ<sub>n</sub> = 220.6 kN/m<sup>2</sup> , σ<sub>u</sub> = 415kN/m<sup>2</sup>.

explanations.b:
We have σm = 44.5/0.5 =89 kN.
The Goodman-Soderberg relation then give σa = σn – (σn /σu) |σm | = 220.6 – (220.6/415) 89 = 146.85
thus FA = 146.85 kN/m2
